column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////My friend has historically disliked deep dish
column2: but he thoroughly enjoyed his Malnati order. Like him
column3: I disliked this style of pizza back home on the West Coast because it always felt like eating a bottle of Prego was dumped onto a loaf of bread. I tried a personal sized Classic with no cheese here and enjoyed the hell out of it--I wasn't even eyeing the cheesy pizzas at my table with envy while I ate my delicious monstrosity. The crust
column5: and tomato sauce still make for a great Chicago deep dish experience. The personal size pizza servings are equivalent to about two small slices.
